question_text: A 56-year-old woman is evaluated for recurrent epistaxis and obscure gastrointestinal bleeding.Physical examination findings on her face are shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: The most likely diagnosis is hereditary hemorrhagic telangiectasia (Option B). Examination of this patient's face and lips reveals the characteristic arteriovenous malformations of hereditary hemorrhagic telangiectasia (also known as Osler-Weber-Rendu disease). This autosomal dominant disorder is commonly associated with epistaxis, gastrointestinal bleeding, and iron deficiency anemia. Other manifestations include arteriovenous malformations in the pulmonary, hepatic, and cerebral circulations.
